data.title: Philip the Good, Duke of Burgundy (1396
data.meta_description: Philip the Good ruled the duchy of Burgundy from 1419 to 1467. An active patron of the arts, he had strong links with Henry VIs court in England though he preferred to concentrate on the expansion of his own land rather than becoming embroiled in the Hundred Years War.He is shown here wearing the collar of the Order of the Golden Fleece, which he established on 10 January 1430 in emulation of the English Order of the Garter; he had been invited to become a Garter Knight but declined for fear of offending...
